title.justification: This is the official title of the paper.

extractions.description: This paper explores the use of autoencoders to model dynamics in nonlinear dynamical systems (NLDS) for long-horizon state prediction. It introduces a method called Periodic Reencoding to address limitations in long-term predictions.

type.justification: The paper includes experiments to validate the proposed model and methods on different datasets.
type.quote: We justify this method both analytically and empirically via experiments in low and high dimensional NLDS.

name.justification: The primary focus is on predicting future states in a temporal sequence.
name.quote: We introduce a simple inference method called Periodic Reencoding that produces high accuracy predictions over long horizons.

name.justification: The proposed method is evaluated on offline reinforcement learning datasets.
name.quote: ...and also demonstrate these findings on offline reinforcement learning datasets in more complex environments within D4RL (Fu et al., 2020).

name.justification: The paper deals with modeling and control of nonlinear dynamical systems.
name.quote: Theoretically, such features can be used to simplify many problems in modeling and control of NLDS.

name.justification: The paper introduces and validates the Periodic Reencoding method as a core contribution.
name.quote: we introduce a simple inference method called Periodic Reencoding that produces high accuracy predictions over long horizons.

is_contributed.justification: The model is introduced by the authors of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: we introduce a simple inference method called Periodic Reencoding that produces high accuracy predictions over long horizons.

is_executed.justification: The paper provides empirical validation of the model.
is_executed.quote: We justify this method both analytically and empirically via experiments

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the proposed method with other unrolling methods in the experiments.
is_compared.quote: We observe that periodically applying reencoding is an effective way to mitigate the drift accumulated by generating trajectories in the latent space.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This model was not introduced in another paper.

name.justification: The dataset is used for evaluation in the experiments.
name.quote: demonstrate these findings on offline reinforcement learning datasets in more complex environments within D4RL (Fu et al., 2020).

referenced_paper_title.value: D4rl: Datasets for Deep Data-Driven Reinforcement Learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the referenced paper title for the D4RL dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Lastly we employ our proposed approach as an open-loop controller for locomotion tasks in D4RL.
